name: Natural Bridges National Monument
description: Three majestic natural bridges invite you to ponder the power of water in a landscape usually defined by its absence. View them from an overlook, or hit the trails and experience their grandeur from below. Declared a National Monument in 1908, the bridges are named "Kachina," "Owachomo" and "Sipapu" in honor of the Ancestral Puebloans who once made this place their home.
shortDescription: Three majestic natural bridges invite you to ponder the power of water in a landscape usually defined by its absence. View them from an overlook, or hit the trails and experience their grandeur from b...

address.line2: Approximately 45 minutes' drive west of Blanding, Utah

operatingHours.description: Natural Bridges National Monument is generally open 24 hours a day, year-round.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: Entry fee admits one private, non-commercial vehicle driver and passengers. Entry fee is valid for 7 days.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: Admits one individual with no car. This pass is typically used for bicyclists, and pedestrians. Youth 15 and under are admitted free. Entry fee is valid for 7 days.

climate.weatherDescription: Natural Bridges is part of the Colorado Plateau, a "high desert" region that experiences wide temperature fluctuations, sometimes over 40 degrees in a single day. The temperate (and most popular) seasons are spring (April-May) and fall (mid-September-October), when daytime highs average 60 to 80 F and lows average 30 to 50 F. Summer temperatures often exceed 100 F, making strenuous exercise difficult. Winters are cold, with highs averaging 30 to 50 F, and lows averaging 0 to 20 F.

images.title: Dark Skies at Owachomo Bridge
images.altText: a natural bridge at night with the Milky Way arcing overhead
images.caption: Natural Bridges National Monument was designated the world's first International Dark Sky Park in 2007

images.title: Sipapu Bridge
images.altText: Sipapu Bridge with a blue sky and clouds overhead
images.caption: Sipapu Bridge is one of the three massive bridges at the monument.

images.title: Horse Collar Ruin
images.altText: a stone structure below a rock alcove
images.caption: Horsecollar Ruins are located near Sipapu Bridge

images.title: Hiker at Kachina Bridge
images.altText: a hiker standing below a massive natural bridge
images.caption: Hiking trails link the three natural bridges at the monument.

images.title: Owachomo Bridge
images.altText: a broad natural bridge with clouds in the sky
images.caption: Owachomo Bridge is one of the three natural bridges at the monument.
